intro: Erodium manescavi var. genuinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species belonging to the Geraniaceae family. The plant features small, pink to violet flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are slender and branching. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and along field edges.
